instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1989: What is A1989? A1989 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2018, 2019 with EMC 3124, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00850..
definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with NAND/SSD issues (<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2018)
threads.message: This <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board came in with missing SSD power rail <SIGNAL>PP2V7_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL>. I found a 2Ω short to ground on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_SSD0</SIGNAL>, which I fixed by replacing the voltage regulator <CHIP>U9080</CHIP>. Now I am left with a short on <SIGNAL>PP2V7_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL> (4Ω to ground). Injection of 2V into <SIGNAL>PP2V7_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL> warms up all four NAND chips. Is there any hope that the SSD is not toast?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with NAND/SSD issues (<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2018)
threads.message: If the chips heat, no doubt...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with NAND/SSD issues (<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2018)
threads.message: Is is possible to replace these chips with ones from a donor board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with NAND/SSD issues (<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2018)
threads.message:
Yes, but mark them before removing.
You must solder each chip in the same position.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with NAND/SSD issues (<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2018)
threads.message: I can report successful replacement of the 4 NAND chips from a donor board to this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board. For reballing, I used an iPhone NAND stencil.
